member.name: T:AsyncAwaitBestPractices.MVVM.AsyncCommand`1
member.summary: An implmentation of IAsyncCommand. Allows Commands to safely be used asynchronously with Task.

member.name: M:AsyncAwaitBestPractices.MVVM.AsyncCommand`1.#ctor(System.Func{`0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Func{System.Object,System.Boolean},System.Action{System.Exception},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Function executed when Execute or ExecuteAysnc is called. This does not check canExecute before executing and will execute even if canExecute is false
The Function that verifies whether or not AsyncCommand should execute.
If an exception is thrown in the Task, onException will execute. If onException is null, the exception will be re-thrown

If set to true continue on captured context; this will ensure that the Synchronization Context returns to the calling thread. If set to false continue on a different context; this will allow the Synchronization Context to continue on a different thread

member.name: E:AsyncAwaitBestPractices.MVVM.AsyncCommand`1.CanExecuteChanged
member.summary: Occurs when changes occur that affect whether or not the command should execute

member.name: M:AsyncAwaitBestPractices.MVVM.AsyncCommand`1.CanExecute(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the command can execute in its current state
member.returns: true, if this command can be executed; otherwise, false.
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.

member.name: M:AsyncAwaitBestPractices.MVVM.AsyncCommand`1.RaiseCanExecuteChanged
member.summary: Raises the CanExecuteChanged event.

member.name: M:AsyncAwaitBestPractices.MVVM.AsyncCommand`1.ExecuteAsync(`0)
member.summary: Executes the Command as a Task
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.
